nodes.text: I am pleased to announce that Joel Kyro has been rescued from the Catacombs by Herr O'Conner.
Joel is alive!?!
Indeed, thanks to Herr O'Conner's courage and loyalty. At the moment though, Herr Kyro is in critical condition despite Lady Moira's healing magic. We do not yet know if he will fully recover.
We will speak more of this when I know the extent of Herr Kyro's condition.
Herr O'Conner has found Herr Kyro is trapped in the Catacombs by a Wraith. He and Lady Glenshannon will be mounting a rescue as soon as possible.
Joel is alive!?!
We believe so. Unfortunately, a Wraith is an extremely dangerous creature and must be dealt with in a specific manner. It is not something that anyone can face without magical protections.
Herr Kyro has not been seen for a day, nor did he leave the school grounds by conventional methods. I suggest that you all take some time from your busy social schedules to look around for him.
Rogues look after their own.

options.text: Tell About Joel and the Wraith

nodes.text: Joel is trapped by a Wraith in the Catacombs.
You know this for a fact? Then why did you not speak to me immediately about this?
Uh... I didn't get a chance... I found out late yesterday...
Very well, go immediately to the Infirmary and inform Lady Moira of this situation. A Wraith is a deadly monster. Herr Kyro may already be dead.
Shouldn't you dismiss class so that we can go looking for Joel? He may be in danger...
I appreciate your concern, Herr Kent. It is a fine suggestion. It is extremely likely that Herr Kyro's life is in danger. However, I do not want to send you into that danger unprepared.
(whispered) Because no one else will.
Did you say something, Fräulein MacMichael?
Er... should we do this in place of our schoolwork practice?
I believe that searching for Herr Kyro will require the use of your skills, so yes. Rescuing your classmate has priority.
Today I shall talk about something that could improve your survival skills against magical creatures - 'The Way of the Zauberer.'
Or for you plebeians unfamiliar with the Germanish language, 'The Way of the Magic User.'
This is a world of magic. It is part of our lives. There are magical doors that appear only when you have permission to pass through them. There are magical locks that require magical keys.
Or magical lockpicks.
Quite.
And some magical creatures, such as the Undead, cannot be damaged or trapped by conventional methods.

In the store, Gregor sells two different types of magical runes with which you can deal with magical creatures. These are used as you would do traps - place them down in the path of the creature as it approaches you.
You can also purchase Eau d'Enchant, a liquid that you can apply to a weapon to make it temporarily magical. It will enhance the damage the weapon does against magical or non-magical creatures.
It is the best policy to avoid conflict with magical creatures and Undead. However, both the Null and the Sol runes may save your life if used appropriately when you encounter Undead.
Any questions?

nodes.commentor: Some of the info below seems like info that all players will need - restricting to one question may be a problem.

nodes.text: What kind of magical creatures are you talking about?
Some Undead like the Pirate Zombies in the sea caves and the Lemures that haunt the catacombs have some vestige of their original form. Physical items can damage them slightly. Traps can detain them.
Certain living creatures like Sea Serpents have magical defenses that protect them from minor physical damage. Such creatures are very difficult to kill by conventional means.

However, Ghosts and Wraiths have no physical form - they are spirits freed from the flesh. Thus, no mere physical item affects them. Your traps and throwing items are useless against them. You must use magic.
What are Runestones?
Runestones are clay tablets imbued with magical spells. The spells are activated when a creature passes over it.
The store sells a Sol runestone that flashes a bright light when a creature moves over it. This does not affect normal creatures, but it damages anything Undead by nature.
The Null runestone creates a field through which magic cannot pass. It is a portable shield against magical attacks. However, it has no effect upon physical attacks.
Will a rune ruin a Wraith's day when its spells are spoiled by magical clay?
Wraiths are not a joking matter. They are one of the most dangerous creatures you are likely to encounter. I suggest that you avoid any encounter with them.
Do you think that Joel is in serious trouble?
There is a great deal of danger in this world. Herr Kyro undoubtedly ran into some sort of danger or difficulty.
Professor Featherstonehaugh has scried the castle, but found no trace of Herr Kyro. He left the school premises without informing anyone.
He didn't say anything to me about leaving the school when we last spoke.
You are all very bright and talented individuals. Put those talents to good use by rescuing our fellow Rogue. Find Herr Kyro.
Very well, then let us all hope that Herr Kyro recovers quickly from his ordeal in the Catacombs.
Entlassen.
